description: The QRD segment is used to define a query

1.name: Query Date/Time
1.description: This field contains the date the query was generated by the application program

10.name: What Department Data Code
10.description:
This field contains the possible contents including test number, procedure number, drug code, item number, order number, etc.

The contents of this field are determined by the contents of the previous field. This field could contain multiple occurrences separated by repetition delimiters

11.name: What Data Code Value Qualifier
11.description: This field contains the what data code value qualifier. A window or range to further refine the inquiry. This field would contain start/stop separated by component separators

12.name: Query Results Level
12.description: This field is used to control level of detail in results. Refer to HL7 table 0108 - Query results level for valid values. See chapters 4 and 7.
12.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

2.name: Query Format Code
2.description: This field refers to HL7 table 0106 - Query/response format code for valid values
2.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

3.name: Query Priority
3.description: This field contains the time frame in which the response is expected. Refer to HL7 table 0091 - Query priority for valid values. Table values and subsequent fields specify time frames for response
3.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

4.name: Query ID
4.description: This field contains a unique identifier for the query. Assigned by the querying application. Returned intact by the responding application

5.name: Deferred Response Type
5.description: This field refers to HL7 table 0107 - Deferred response type for valid entries
5.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

6.name: Deferred Response Date/Time
6.description: This field contains the date/time before or after which to send a deferred response. If not present, the response can be sent when its available. (See QRD-5-deferred response type above).

7.name: Quantity Limited Request
7.description: This field contains the maximum length of the response that can be accepted by the requesting system. Valid responses are numerical values given in the units specified in the second component. Refer to HL7 table 0126 - Quantity limited request for valid entries. Default is LI lines

8.name: Who Subject Filter
8.description: This field identifies the subject, or who the inquiry is about
8.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number And Name

9.name: What Subject Filter
9.description: This field describes the kind of information that is required to satisfy the request. Valid values define the type of transaction inquiry and may be extended locally during implementatio
